summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the SDNY Epstein investigation. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, sharing evidence (including phone records showing contacts with underage girls), and potential proffer agreements.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney at the law firm representing the subpoenaed client, coordinating meetings with prosecutors and handling document exchanges.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Lead defense attorney representing the subpoenaed client, communicating with SDNY prosecutors about the grand jury subpoena and potential cooperation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of the subpoenaed client.
Bloom is the partner formally retained to represent the client who received the SDNY grand jury subpoena.
Hudgens is an associate attorney working on the defense team for the subpoenaed client.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an unnamed individual (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date the subpoenaed client was required to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned pending discussions.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorneys propose a meeting with SDNY prosecutors to discuss the subpoena and potential next steps.

events.title: Scheduled Call to Discuss Next Steps
events.description: Prosecutors and defense attorneys schedule a call for Monday afternoon to discuss further actions regarding the subpoena.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP)
keyFacts: Prosecutors possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the subpoenaed client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls at the time of the calls.

The defense attorneys were formally retained in July 2019 to represent the client who received the SDNY grand jury subpoena, and were in discussions about a potential voluntary interview or proffer agreement.
Multiple civil case dockets related to Jeffrey Epstein are referenced, including cases in SDNY and Florida federal court.
The client's identity is not explicitly named in the document but is heavily implied to be Ghislaine Maxwell based on context and timing.
Prosecutors provided defense with transcripts of court proceedings and a standard proffer agreement as part of their discussions.
